III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff are abusing Youth A. Staff took Youth A’s cellular device
and do not allow youth access to the computer for homework.
Staff are not allowing Youth A to receive incoming calls and do not
answer the phone for emergency situations. On 4/7/24, staff
turned off the electricity to the cottages.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
06/20/2024.
Complainant was anonymous.
Chief Administrator was interviewed on 06/20/2024 at the
facility. Chief Administrator reported Youth A was discharged from
their program on 06/18/2024 and is currently in the independent
living program through Methodist. She said Youth A was attending
school off site and therefore did not require a laptop to do
homework. She is not aware of reports or concerns regarding
Youth A not being able to receive calls and staff not answering
phone calls for emergency situations. Chief Administrator
reported Youth A did have a cell phone. At the time of placement
his cell phone was taken away because youths are not allowed to
have cell phones. She said his cell was returned to him when he
was discharged from the facility. The facility has backup
generators and there are no reports of staff turning off electricity or
the facility losing power.
Director was interviewed on 06/20/2024 at the facility. Director
reported Youth A was placed at the facility for four months and
completed the program successfully. He reported Youth A did very
well in school and was a straight A student. Director recalled one
incident report for Youth A while placed at the facility. He denied
Youth A was ever denied phone calls or staff does not answer
telephone calls for Youth A or any other youth.
2

Youth A was interviewed on 06/24/2024 at the Independent Living
Facility. Youth A is 17 years old and has been at the current
placement for one week. Youth A reported he was placed at
Methodist for four months. He denied any issues or concerns
while placed at Methodist. Youth A reported he was able to make
phone calls to family members and his worker. He denied being
denied access to making or receiving phone calls. Youth A
admitted his cell phone was taken away when he was placed at
Methodist, but his cell phone was returned to him when he was
discharged. Youth A reported he attended Redford High School
while placed at access and did not require the use of computer to
do homework. Youth A recalled there was one incident that
occurred before he left the facility, involving Staff 2 cussing at him.
He said Staff 2 laughed at him and when he asked her why she
was laughing, she called him a “Bitch.” He said there were several
staff and youths who witnessed the incident. Youth A didn’t report
any other concerns regarding the facility.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed on 06/24/2024 via
telephone. Foster Care Worker reported Youth A was placed at
the facility for four months and did well in the program and school.
She said Youth A never reported any concerns regarding the
facility or staff.
Supervisor was interviewed on 06/27/2024 at the facility.
Supervisor has been working at the agency for 6 months.
Supervisor recalled the incident between Youth A and Staff 2. She
said Youth A was the one that cussed and threaten Staff 2. She
denied witnessing Staff 2 saying anything inappropriate to Youth
A. Supervisor further denied any incident where staff denied Youth
A making/receiving phone calls, or not answering phone calls for
emergencies.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 06/27/2024 at the facility. Staff 1 has
been working at the agency for one year. He reported youths are
allowed to making phone calls anytime as along as staff supervise
the calls. He denied any incidents where the electricity was turned
off in the cottages. Staff 1 recalled there was an incident involving
Youth A threatening Staff 2 and calling her a “Bitch.” He denied
Staff 2 said anything inappropriate to Youth A.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed on 06/27/2024 at the
facility. Youth B and Youth C reported they make and receive
phone calls from family members. Youth B and Youth C said they
always have electricity in the cottages. Youth B and Youth C
3

denied hearing Staff 2 call Youth A or any other youths the “B”
word. Youth B and Youth C reported feeling safe and all their
needs are being met.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 07/16/2024 via telephone. Staff 2 has
been working at the facility for one year. Staff 2 recalled there was
an incident on 06/11/2024 and she was outside with Staff 1,
Supervisor, and several other youths. She said Youth A came up
to her because he thought she was laughing at him, Youth A
threatened her, told her he was going to have his mother come to
the facility and “whoop her ass” and called her a “Bitch”. She
denied using any profanity with Youth A.
Tour Observation:
I completed a walk through the agency on 06/20/2024 and
06/24/2024. I observed the two cottages, administrative building,
kitchen area, and all they all had working electricity.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 06/11/2024, written by Staff 2.
Incident report is consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
• Agency policy for family services: The agency with each
child’s individual Treatment Plan, offer flexible hours to
meet the family’s time schedule and provide an identifiable
area for family visits that offer privacy, security, and
comfort. Family involvement is highly encouraged and
includes monthly family forums; monthly family
psychoeducation groups and family support groups located
on campus. Services offered to family members include
visitation, monthly case conferences, family phone calls,
and family therapy and family fun events.
• Personnel file for Staff 1 -no disciplinary action.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted with staff and youths, there is
insufficient evidence to support the allegations.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
